awardEventDetails.description: Roger Munns - Ted Giffords - Nuno Sá - Alfredo Barroso - Gavin Thurston - Chris Bryan - Tom Fitz - Steve Hathaway - Roger Horrocks - David Reichert

awardEventDetails.title: 2018 Nominee RTS Craft & Design Award
awardEventDetails.description: Roger Munns - Gavin Thurston - Nuno Sá - Alfredo Barroso - Ted Giffords - Chris Bryan - Hugh Miller - Dan Beecham - Roger Horrocks - David Reichert

awardEventDetails.title: 2018 Winner RTS West Television Award
awardEventDetails.description: Adam Inglis (colourist)

awardEventDetails.title: 2018 Winner Golden Kapok Award
awardEventDetails.description: James Honeyborne (director) (Filmed over four years covering every continent and ocean, this sequel to 2001's multi-award winning The Blue Planet promises to take viewers on a revelatory and magical journey into the greatest, yet least known parts of our planet-our oceans. By using breakthroughs in science and cutting-edge technology to explore this final frontier, the series will reveal the astonishing characters, otherworldly places and extraordinary new animal behaviours. Warm and compelling stories about marine habitats and their characterful inhabitants will build people's emotional relationship with our oceans and bring a new perspective to this little-known world.)

awardEventDetails.title: 2018 Nominee BAFTA Television Craft Award
awardEventDetails.description: Nigel Buck (For episode "The Deep (2017)".)

awardEventDetails.title: 2018 Winner BAFTA Television Craft Award
awardEventDetails.description: (For episode "One Ocean (2017)".)

awardEventDetails.title: 2018 Nominee BAFTA Television Craft Award
awardEventDetails.description: Matt Meech (For episode "One Ocean (2017)".)

awardsHtml:
11 wins & 13 nominations

Outstanding Documentary or Nonfiction Series
James Honeyborne - Mark Brownlow - Jonathan Smith
2018 Winner Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Narrator
David Attenborough (For episode "One Ocean")
2018 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Cinematography for a Nonfiction Program
Gavin Thurston (photography) (For episode "The Deep")
2018 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Cinematography for a Nonfiction Program
Ted Giffords (photography) - Roger Munns (photography) (For episode "One Ocean")
2018 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Sound Editing for a Nonfiction Program (Single or Multi-Camera)
Kate Hopkins (sound editor) - Tim Owens (sound editor) (For episode: "Coral Reefs".)

2018 Winner RTS West Television Award

Guangzhou International Documentary Film Festival (GZDOC)

2018 Winner Golden Kapok Award
BEST DOCUMENTARY SERIES
James Honeyborne (director) (Filmed over four years covering every continent and ocean, this sequel to 2001's multi-award winning The Blue Planet promises to take viewers on a revelatory and magical journey into the greatest, yet least known parts of our planet-our oceans. By using breakthroughs in science and cutting-edge technology to explore this final frontier, the series will reveal the astonishing characters, otherworldly places and extraordinary new animal behaviours. Warm and compelling stories about marine habitats and their characterful inhabitants will build people's emotional relationship with our oceans and bring a new perspective to this little-known world.)

2018 Winner Broadcasting Press Guild Award
Best Documentary Series
